content: 5 row work knit 3 stitches purl 4 stitches knit 4 stitches repeat 3 times knit 3 stitches or k3 p4 k4 x3 k3 27 28 29 30 31 f same as d for 5 row work k3 k4 p4 x3 k3 32 33 34 35 36 g same as e for 5 row work k3 p4 k4 x3 k3 37 38 39 40 41 h same as d for 5 row work k3 k4 p4 x3 k3 42 43 44 45 46 i same as e for 5 row work k3 p4 k4 x3 k3 47 48 49 50 51 j same as d for 5 row work k3 k4 p4 x3 k3 52 53 54 55 56 k same as e for 5 row work k3 p4 k4 x3 k3 57 58 59 60 61 l same as d for 5 row work k3 k4 p4 x3 k3 62 63 64 65 66 m knit 6 row 67 68 69 70 71 72 this is where you need to check your gauge you want to measure the center section of your scarf below my sample is 16 stitches and 22 row per 4 inch square if you are happy with your fabric carry on regardless of gauge if your fabric is too loose or too tight start again with a smaller or bigger needle part 2 70 row this is a simple 4 row repeat this means that you will knit 4 row according to the pattern and then you will knit those 4 row again… and again… and again… a knit 6 row 1 2 3 4 5 6 b begin the repeat section knit through these 4 row 14 times the row are set for you to cross off after you complete them row 1 k to end 7 11 15 19 23 27 31 35 39 43 47 51 55 59 row 2 k to end 8 12 16 20 24 28 32 36 40 44 48 52 56 60 row 3 k3 k1 p1 x12 k3 9 13 17 21 25 29 33 37 41 45 49 53 57 61 row 4 k3 k1 p1 x12 k3 10 14 18 22 26 30 34 38 42 46 50 54 58 62 row from above written out row 1 and 2 knit all stitches row 3 and 4 knit 3 stitches knit 1 stitch purl 1 stitch twelve times knit last 3 stitches c knit 8 row 63 64 65 66 67 68 69 70 part 3 68 row for this one you will have a 6-row repeat a knit 6 row 1 2 3 4 5 6 b here we begin the repeat section knit through these 6 row 9 times the row are set for you to cross off after you complete them row 1 k3 k3 p3 x2 p3 k3 x2 k3 7 13 19 25 31 37 43 49 55 row 2 k3 k1 p3 k2 x2 k2 p3 k1 x2
